sources.title: "Soul-Fire" (1925) director John S. Robertson
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   We have included this film in our program to illustrate the work and contributions of director John S. Robertson, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.  "Soul-Fire" is an emotional drama. A young composer suffers for inspiration in Europe, and then fate takes him to Southern seas. Directed by                     John S. Robertson Produced by                   Inspiration Pictures Written by                      Josephine Lovett Based on                         the play by Martin Brown Starring                          Richard Barthelmess, Bessie Love, Carlotta Monterey, Walter Long, Richard Harlan Cinematography            Roy Overbaugh    Distributed by                First National Pictures Release date                    May 31, 1925 Running time                  80 minutes Country                           United States Language                         Silent film, English intertitles Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: Eric Fane is a composer unwilling to compromise his dream for a steady job back home in the United States.
metadata.Writer: Martin Brown (play), Josephine Lovett, Agnes Smith (titles)
metadata.Actors: Richard Barthelmess, Bessie Love, Percy Ames, Charles Esdale
